titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Ruth S. Harley family papers 2000.013
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:17:27 +0000.

did.abstract: This collection consists of photographs, programs, and certificates relating to Ruth S. Harley's time as a student at Erasmus Hall High School, as well as an Erasmus Hall songbook and history. Additional items include photographs of Ruth S. Harley as a student at Public School 139 and the Cortelyou School, photographs of Jeanette H. and Robert Harley, and photocopies of Walter Harley's obituary. Items date from 1908 to 1959.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Harley family lived at 498 Rugby Road in the Brooklyn neighborhood of Flatbush. Walter Harley (d. 1959) taught Greek and Latin at Erasmus Hall High School. His children included Jeanette H. (Harley) Huber, Robert Harley, and Ruth S. Harley, dean of women at Adelphi College.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of photographs, programs, and certificates relating to Ruth S. Harley's time as a student at Erasmus Hall High School, as well as an Erasmus Hall songbook and history. Additional items include photographs of Ruth S. Harley as a student at Public School 139 and the Cortelyou School, photographs of Jeanette H. and Robert Harley, and photocopies of Walter Harley's obituary. Items date from 1908 to 1959.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Ruth S. Harley, date unknown. Formally accessioned in 2000.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.
